questions.question: I told him ................................. be late.
questions.description: We put not before the infinitive.

questions.question: The teacher asked us .................................. our assignments.
questions.description: Imperatives are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The teacher asked if I ..................................... the answer.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the subordinate verb, too, will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: I asked the manager if I .................................. leave early.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the subordinate verb, too, will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: They asked me ........................................ interested in the offer.
questions.description: We use the normal word order in indirect questions - that means the subject goes before the auxiliary.

questions.question: She said that no one .......................................... forward to help her.
He asked me what I ...................................... do if I lost my job.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the subordinate verb, too, will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: They encouraged her .................................... another attempt.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by object + to-infinitive.
